intro: Philocrena, commonly known as the false holly or white holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their evergreen leaves and small, often white or pale pink flowers. They typically thrive in acidic soils and are often found in forested or rocky areas. Philocrena species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
